video.title: Git & GitHub: Undoing Commits
video.description:
We're busy people who learn to code, then practice by building projects for nonprofits. Learn Full-stack JavaScript, build a portfolio, and get great references with our open source community.

Join our community at https://freecodecamp.com
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/freecodecamp
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/freecodecamp
Follow Quincy on Quora: https://www.quora.com/Quincy-Larson

topLevelComment.author: Juani
topLevelComment.text: Malísima la explicación. Con git reset se retorna a un commit anterior y se debe especificar el id para seleccionarlo.

topLevelComment.author: Code_Spiders
topLevelComment.text: very well explained, excellent work just as suggest please do some more elaboration add some terminal changes, overall nice job

topLevelComment.author: earthfire waterair
topLevelComment.text: thx you

topLevelComment.author: Goran Vasić
topLevelComment.text: Um... How does "git cherry-pick" undo a commit? Doesn't it copy a commit from a separate branch?

topLevelComment.author: James 羽入 Smith
topLevelComment.text: Oh my goodness!!! Thank you.  I'm new to the web development field, and one video talked about needing to start using github. I watched over 30 different videos, explaining "everything you need to know about Git and GitHub" but NONE of them have been able to explain it, to a newbie, such as myself. This introductory playlist has taught me more than all 30 of those videos - combined. And NOW, having watched your video series, I can go back, and understand what all 30 of those videos even mean. Thank you.

topLevelComment.author: progTom
topLevelComment.text: I just finished the whole playlist, a great, simple, succinct descriptions for the basics of git... and no padding either, straight to the point every video!! Thanks guys!

topLevelComment.author: Vivek Chhetri
topLevelComment.text: Okay the entire playlist was fast and informative.
